docs.title: MonsterBox
docs.text: MonsterBox is a refactored scene builder application designed to manage scenes and steps efficiently for animatronic automation. It integrates hardware components (I2C, GPIO, servos, sensors, audio, cameras) and provides a web-based interface for easy control and configuration.

docs.title: Coffin Breaker — Cyberpunk Character SheetCoffin Breaker
docs.text: Description: Our spanish lady has been trapped in the coffin for a thousand years, and now she's breaking out! Hardware Overview: Coffin Sensor (sensor), GPIO: 16 Coffin door (linear-actuator), DIR: 5, PWM: 13 Burning Rose (light), GPIO: 16 Sound List: Coffin Creaking (1729640529230-coffin_door_creaking.mp3) Coffin Background (1729640707787-07 - The Coffin.mp3) Coffin Breathing (1729640735282-11 - Breathing (In Terror).mp3) Welcome to Coralville, Where it's colder than Hell! docs.title: Orlok — Cyberpunk Character SheetOrlok
docs.text: Description: A mysterious nobleman and vampire who lives alone in his ruined castle, who wants to acquire a new property in Germany. He was once a Solomonar who was cursed by the Devil to become a vampire. Hardware Overview: Right Arm of Satan (linear-actuator), DIR: 23, PWM: 12 Left Arm of Manipulation (linear-actuator), DIR: 18, PWM: 13 Hand of Azura (light), GPIO: 26 Eye of Orlok (sensor), GPIO: 16 Elbow (servo), Pin: 3 Forearm (servo), Pin: 3 Head on a Swivel (servo), Pin: 3 Hand Light: 26 Motor1: DIR=18, PWM=13 Motor2: DIR=23, PWM=12 PIR Sensor: 16 LED: 17 Servo: 6 Sound List: Good Evening (1729639541789-Evening.mp3) Satanas Lucifer (1729639570661-satanas-lucifer.mp3) Speaking in tongues (1729639678184-gibberish words.mp3) I have bad weather (1730414837585-I_have_bad_weather.mp3) I hate bad weather (1730414851165-I_hate_bad_weather.mp3) My Head Is Spinning (1730416580678-My_Head_Is_Spinning.mp3) If you think it's cold in hell, check Coralville out!  (1730416624369-If_you_think_it_s_cold_in_hell.mp3) Happy Halloween Coralville!  (1730416677959-Happy_Halloween_Coralville__.mp3) IN The DESERT BY Stephen Crane (1730416871366-IN_The_DESERT__BY_Stephen_Cran.mp3) Listen up, Iowa kiddies (1730421630880-Listen_up__Iowa_kiddies_so_swe.mp3) Scary Latin (1730421695207-Audite__dulces_pueri_Iovenses_.mp3) The Devil's Detective (1730504652559-The_Devil_s_Detective_In_Iowa_.mp3) Don't Forget to Vote!  (1730504876171-Don_t_Forget_to_Vote__I_m_watc.mp3) Notes/Improvements: –

docs.title: PumpkinHead — Cyberpunk Character SheetPumpkinHead
docs.text: Description: The pumpkin patch has been full of the little guys, but who minds them? Pumpkinhead! Hardware Overview: Body Swing (motor), DIR: 26, PWM: 13 Punkin Motion Detector (sensor), GPIO: 16 Head Light (led), GPIO: 17 Scary Body Mover (motor), DIR: 6, PWM: 13 Sound List: Monster Howl (1729640808280-monster-howl-85304.mp3) Monster Snarl (1729640824676-monster-snarl-5-69062.mp3) Big Roar (1729640841292-Roar.mp3) Random Growling Sounds (1729640860311-random-monster-sounds-29328.mp3) Notes/Improvements: –

docs.title: Character sheet
docs.text:
Cyberpunk Character Sheet Name: NeoSynth Description: Elite netrunner with a mysterious past. Master of digital infiltration. IP Address: 192.168.1.42 Samba Login: neosynth Samba Password: ******** SSH Login: neo@cyberdeck SSH Password: ******** Hardware Overview:
  • Raspberry Pi 4B
  • USB Camera (active)
  • Adafruit Audio FX Sound Board
  • Servo Controller (PCA9685)
Video Usage: Camera active, streaming to HQ Sound List:
  • startup.wav (2s)
  • alarm.wav (5s)
  • greeting.wav (3s)
Notes/Improvements: Upgrade to infrared camera. Add voice modulation for disguise operations.

docs.title: Configuration Details
docs.text:
• .env defines environment variables
  • JSON files in data/ hold persistent settings
  • Match GPIO/I2C pin numbers to your hardware setup
  • Place custom scripts in scripts/ directory

docs.title: FAQ / Troubleshooting
docs.text:
Q: Interface not loading? A: Ensure dependencies are installed and .env is set up.

Q: Hardware unresponsive? A: Check GPIO/I2C pin config and wiring.

Q: How to add characters or parts? A: Use the web UI.

Q: Where are logs? A: Accessible via web UI or in log/ dir.

docs.title: 1. Clone the repository
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/monsterbox.git
cd monsterbox

docs.title: 2. First-Time Setup (Full System)
docs.text:
Use this for a fresh Raspberry Pi or major re-deployment. This will upgrade the OS, install all dependencies, configure hardware, and set permissions:

sudo bash install.sh

docs.title: 3. Set up environment variables
docs.text: Create a .env file in the project root. See .env.example for variables.

docs.title: 4. Routine Updates (Dependencies/Services)
docs.text:
For regular updates (after initial setup), use:

sudo bash update.sh

This script updates only project dependencies and ensures required services are running (no full OS upgrade).

docs.title: 5. Run the application
docs.text: npm start

docs.title: License
docs.text: MIT License. See LICENSE file for details.

docs.title: Directory Structure
docs.text:
• controllers/: Business logic
  • data/: Configuration JSON
  • public/: Static assets
  • routes/: API and routing
  • scripts/: Python/JS scripts
  • services/: Core services
  • tests/: Automated tests
  • views/: EJS web templates

docs.title: Usage Instructions
docs.text:
• Access http://localhost:3000
  • Select a character
  • Navigate through Characters, Parts, Sounds, Scenes, etc.
  • Trigger scenes, view logs, and control devices in real time.

docs.title: System Maintenance
docs.text:
• For regular updates to dependencies and services, run: bash sudo bash update.sh
  • For a full system setup or major re-deployment, run: bash sudo bash install.sh

docs.title: Animatronics Workshop Overview
docs.text: This section contains guides for working with animatronic characters using the MonsterBox framework. Each subsection provides documentation on setup, hands-on challenges, and integration with AI tools.

docs.text:
• Servos
  • Linear Actuators
  • Camera / Sound / AV

docs.text:
• Git Repo
  • RPi4b
  • MonsterBox
  • AI APIs

docs.title: Integration
docs.text:
• Software Development (Codemium or Windsurf)
  • CI/CD Demonstrations

docs.title: 3. Hands-On Opportunities
docs.text:
• Coffin: ChatGPT integration, customizable voices
  • Count Orlok: OpenCV head tracking
  • Pumpkinhead: ElevenLabs TTS echoing
  • BigMouth Skull: ChatterPi (talking + GPT)
  • SmallMouth Skull: ChatterPi (talking + GPT)

docs.title: 4. Presentation of Monsters
docs.text:
• Possible Contest or Awards
  • Letting GPTs talk to each other
  • Lessons Learned and Suggestions for Improvement

  • Sounds using ElevenLabs AI

docs.text:

docs.title: Hardware Schedule
docs.text:
Core: - Raspberry Pi 4B, 4GB RAM, 256GB SD

Audio Interface: - USB Audio Card

Motor Control: - Cytron 2x10A Motor Driver

Servo Controllers: - PCA9685 Controller

Servos: - Hooyij 40kg Servo - Miuzei MG90S Micro Servo - GoBilda Stingray 2 Servo

Linear Actuators: - 150mm Actuator - 12" Coffin Actuator

Misc: - Jeep Wiper Motor - PIR Motion Sensor
